item.description:
Anyone want to appear in an unusual party scene in Middletown for a short film I'm starring in? You'll be a background performer, part of a strange crowd scene, so no experience or particular skills required with acting, memorizing, etc. Any gender, age (over 18), height, weight, or race is welcome.

Afterwards, if anyone's interested, Middletown has a fantastic Indian restaurant (Haveli India), as well as a laser tag/arcade place (including PS3, Wii, XBox, & PCs), and some clubs that might be good for dancing (or we'll head to New Haven).

You'll have an interesting experience, you'll be fed, & you'll get credit in the film. The precise schedule isn't decided yet, but it'll be something like 10am-5pm on Sunday. There will likely be a number of breaks during the day, since it can sometimes take quite a while to setup camera & lights for a shot, and you probably won't be in every shot. Bring a chatty nature, a book, an iPod, a smartphone, or all 4.

ABOUT THE SHOOT: The film is a high quality Wesleyan Univ. student film (senior project) being shot in black & white on 16mm film. It's a conceptual, mood-driven, surrealistic drama. This scene is part of a dream sequence they're shooting. The shoot is at the Alpha Delta Phi building at Wesleyan.

If you're interested, while I'd enjoy seeing your RSVP so I know who to look for at the shoot, if you're interested, RSVPing is not enough...YOU MUST CONTACT THE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR and be given a spot. His name is Ankur Verma, 860-262-0780 (texting ok too), averma94@gmail.com.

He's been having some problems lately with email, voicemail, and texts, so you should also text or call me and I'll make sure he knows you're coming. I'm 203-901-4957

They already have about 25 people for the scene, they're looking for 10-15 more. In the dream scene, you'd either be a dancer, or a party attendee (tell Ankur which you want to be).

Everyone will be given a masquerade mask to wear (I believe a cat mask). Dress like you're going to a nice cocktail party. Women should wear flowing dresses, men wear dressy pants, buttoned shirts, and if you've got it, blazer/jacket.

Dancers would have to go to Middletown (Schoenberg Dance Studio, 247 Pine St) for a few hours (11am-1pm) the day BEFORE (on Sat.) for a free workshop in how to waltz (I will not be at workshop).

At the shoot, I'll be going through the crowd looking for a lost friend. At the end, the crowd mobs me and captures me.

You know, your standard cat party dream. ;) Except no dismembered rodents.

HOST: Jason, 203-901-4957. Texts are fine too
item.name: Sun 11/22 - Be an animal, get free food. Free waltz lessons & laser tag optional
